CanvasApplet Class Reference

Avaliable Methods



public method new ()

Detailed Description

The secret to making this applet work with IE in addition to normal browsers is the addition of the C(<form></form>) construct just before the object.

For some reason IE has trouble locating a flash object which is contained within a form. Adding this second blank form with the larger problemMainForm seems to solve the problem.

This follows method2 of the advice given in url(http://kb.adobe.com/selfservice/viewContent.do?externalId=kb400730&amp;sliceId=2) Method1 and methods involving SWFObject(Geoff Stearns) and SWFFormFix (Steve Kamerman) have yet to be fully investigated: http://devel.teratechnologies.net/swfformfix/swfobject_swfformfix_source.js http://www.teratechnologies.net/stevekamerman/index.php?m=01&amp;y=07&amp;entry=entry070101-033933

use constant CANVAS_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT'; <form></form> <script> var width = 200; var height = 200;</script> <canvas name="cv" id="cv" data-src="<a href="http://localhost/webwork2_files/js/sketchgraphhtml5b/SketchGraph.pjs">http://localhost/webwork2_files/js/sketchgraphhtml5b/SketchGraph.pjs</a>" width="400" height="400"></canvas> END_OBJECT_TEXT

sub new {
    my $class = shift;
    $class -> SUPER::new(   objectText   => CANVAS_OBJECT_TEXT(),
                            headerText   => CANVAS_OBJECT_HEADER_TEXT(),
                            type         => 'html5canvas',

}
